Method Detail

readAsString

public static java.lang.String readAsString(java.io.BufferedReader reader)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
Reads a buffered reader as a single string. If there are multi lines, it appends a LINE SEPARATOR.

Parameters:
reader - a reader
Returns:
simple string representation of the entire reader. careful with the memory usage.
Throws:
NullPointerException: - if reader is null.
java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

readAsStringList

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> readAsStringList(java.io.BufferedReader reader)
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
Reads a reader as a list of strings. each item represents one line in the reader.

Parameters:
reader - a reader
Returns:
List of strings.
Throws:
NullPointerException: - if reader is null.
java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

readAsStringList

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> readAsStringList(java.io.BufferedReader reader,
                                                                boolean trim,
                                                                org.jcaki.Filter... filters)
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
Reads a reader as a list of strings. each item represents one line in the reader which passes the LineConstraints.

Parameters:
reader - a reader
trim - trims the lines if set
filters - zero or more StringFilter. if there are more than one all filters needs to pass the string.
Returns:
List of strings.
Throws:
NullPointerException: - if reader is null.
java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

closeSilently

public static void closeSilently(java.io.Closeable... closeables)
closes the closeables silently, meaning that if the Closeable is null, or if it throws an exception during close() operation it only creates a system error output, does not throw an exception. this is especially useful when you need to close one or more resources in finally blocks. This method should only be called in finalize{} blocks or wherever it really makes sense.

Parameters:
closeables - zero or more closeable.

Returns a BufferedReader for the input stream.

Parameters:
is - input stream
Returns:
a bufferedReader for the input stream.

getReader

public static java.io.BufferedReader getReader(java.io.InputStream is,
                                               java.lang.String charset)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
Returns a Buffered reader for the given input stream and charset. if charset is UTF-8 it explicitly checks for UTF-8 BOM information.

Parameters:
is - input stream for the reader.
charset - charset string, if null,empty or has only whitespace, system uses default encoding.
Returns:
BufferedReader
Throws:
IOException: - if the given encoding is not supported, or an error occurs if given charset is utf-8 and an IO error occurs during utf-8 BOM detection operation.
java.io.IOException

getIterableReader

public static IterableLineReader getIterableReader(java.io.InputStream is)
returns an IterableLineReader backed by a LineIterator. Can be used directly in enhanced for loops. Please note that if not all the lines are read, reader will not be closed. So, it is suggested to close the IterableLineReader in a finally block using closeSilently(Closeable...)

Parameters:
is - an input stream.
Returns:
an IterableLineReader that can be iterated for lines.

getLineIterator

public LineIterator getLineIterator(java.io.InputStream is)
returns a LineIterator. it is suggested to close th eiterator in a finally block.

Parameters:
is - input stream to read.
Returns:
an IterableLineReader that can be iterated for lines.

getIterableReader

public static IterableLineReader getIterableReader(java.io.InputStream is,
                                                   java.lang.String charset)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
returns an IterableLineReader backed by a LineIterator. Can be used directly in enhanced for loops. Please note that if not all the lines are read, reader will not be closed. So, it is suggested to close the IterableLineReader in a finally block using closeSilently(Closeable...)

Parameters:
is - input stream
charset - the charset.
Returns:
an IterableLineReader that can be iterated for lines.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if charset is not available, or there is an error ocurred during utf-8 test.

Returns:

readAsByteArray

public static byte[] readAsByteArray(java.io.InputStream is)
                              throws java.io.IOException
converts an input stream data to byte array. careful with memory usage here. if aim is to transfer bytes from one stream to another, use copy(java.io.InputStream, java.io.OutputStream) instead.

Parameters:
is - , an input stream
Returns:
a byte array representing the stream data.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during the read or write of the streams.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if input stream is null

writeLines

public static void writeLines(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> lines,
                              java.io.OutputStream output)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Writes the value of each item in a collection to an OutputStream line by line, using the default character encoding of the platform. A Line separator will be added to each line. If there is a null value, an empty line will be added. The output stream will Not be closed once the operation is finished.

copied and modified from Apache Commons-io

Parameters:
lines - the lines to write, null entries produce blank lines
output - the OutputStream to write to, not null, not closed
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the output is null
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

writeLines

public static void writeLines(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> lines,
                              java.io.OutputStream output,
                              java.lang.String encoding)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Writes the toString() value of each item in a collection to an OutputStream line by line, using the default character encoding of the platform. if an element is null, nothing is written for it. The stream will Not be closed once the operation is finished.

copied and modified from commons-io

Parameters:
lines - the lines to write, null entries produce blank lines
output - the OutputStream to write to, not null, not closed
encoding - character encoding.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the output is null
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

Writes the toString() value of each item in a collection to an OutputStream line by line, using the default character encoding of the platform. if an element is null, nothing is written for it. The stream will Not be closed once the operation is finished.

copied and modified from commons-io

lines - the lines to write, null entries produce blank lines
os - the OutputStream to write to, not null, not closed
encoding - character encoding.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the output is null

hexDump

public static void hexDump(java.io.InputStream is,
                           java.io.OutputStream os,
                           int column,
                           long amount)
                    throws java.io.IOException
dumps the contents of an input stream in hex format to an output stream. both stream are closed at the end of method call

Parameters:
is - file
os - output stream to write hex values
column - the column size of the hex numbers.
amount - amount of bytes to write.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is an error while accesing the file or writing the hex values.
